# Get started

If you want to try out Seedling on your local system, want to develop your own content, or want to contribute to Seedling, this should get you up and running.

# Prerequisites

  • Install gitopen in new window if not present
  • Install Node.jsopen in new window, which includes the npmopen in new window (Node Package Manager). A good way to manage Node.js versions is to use NVMopen in new window

# Development setup

Follow these steps to set up a development or test environment on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS or equivalent.

# Clone the Seedling repository

git clone git@github.com:nodepa/seedling.git
1

# Navigate to repo

cd seedling/app
1

# Install Node & NPM

If you do not have NVMopen in new window installed, install Node.jsopen in new window according to your preference, but use the version specified in the project's .nvmrc file. If you do have NVMopen in new window installed, these commands will automatically use the .nvmrc version:

nvm install
nvm use
1
2

# Install packages

npm install
1

# Start the app in local demo

npm start   # Then visit http://localhost:8080 in your web browser
1

# Run full test suite

This command combines the scripts for:

  • install
  • lint
  • test:unit:coverage
  • test:e2e (i.e. end-to-end)
npm run verify
1

# Misc

Play around with your own content by replacing the content/ folder (parallel to the app/ folder) with your own.
